intro: Micromeria taygetea, commonly known as the Greek tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers and finely divided leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. Micromeria taygetea is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
